item.title: 麦当劳 "巨无霸 "鸡肉商标在欧盟汉堡之战中被驳回
item.description: 麦当劳公司失去了其标志性 "巨无霸 "汉堡的鸡肉版在欧盟的商标权，因为法官裁定这家快餐巨头没有采取足够的措施来主张独占权。【原文：McDonald’s Corp.’s lost the European Union trademark rights to chicken versions of its iconic “Big Mac” burgers after judges ruled that the fast food giant failed to do enough to claim exclusive rights.】

item.title: 据说香水零售商 Arabian Oud 将为沙特首次公开募股聘请银行
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，香水零售商 Arabian Oud 已为计划在沙特阿拉伯进行的首次公开募股聘请了银行。【原文：Perfume retailer Arabian Oud has hired banks for a planned initial public offering in Saudi Arabia, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 阿波罗为德国业主债务交易提供高达 1 亿欧元的资金
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management）周三发表声明称，作为与债券持有人达成的高收益债券重组协议的一部分，股东阿波罗全球管理公司将向德国房东 Demire Deutsche Mittelstand Real Estate AG 提供最多 1 亿欧元（1.09 亿美元）的额外资金。【原文：Shareholder Apollo Global Management will provide up to €100 million ($109 million) in additional funds to German landlord Demire Deutsche Mittelstand Real Estate AG as part of a deal agreed with bondholders to restructure its high-yield bond, according to a statement Wednesday.】

item.title: 温德霍斯特在德国银行业规则刑事调查中无罪释放
item.description: 德国金融家拉尔斯-温德霍斯特（Lars Windhorst）因设立融资工具偿还投资公司 H2O Asset Management 的欠款而被德国刑事调查机构认定为违反银行业规定。【原文：German financier Lars Windhorst was cleared by a German criminal investigation into whether he breached banking rules by setting up a financing vehicle to pay back investment firm H2O Asset Management.】

item.title: 印尼盾跌至四年低点促使印尼央行提供支持
item.description: 由于投资者平仓新兴市场利差交易，印尼盾跌至四年来的新低，促使印尼央行口头支持印尼盾。【原文：The Indonesian rupiah declined to a fresh four-year low as investors unwound the emerging-market carry trade, prompting a verbal support for the currency from the nation’s central bank.】

item.title: 英国房东可能加入富时 100 指数，因为 Ocado 结束了长达六年的居留期
item.description: 伦敦计量房地产公司（LondonMetric Property Plc）准备加入富时 100 指数，Ocado 集团公司（Ocado Group Plc）六年来首次跌出英国蓝筹股行列。【原文：LondonMetric Property Plc is poised to join the FTSE 100 Index in a reshuffle that’s set to see Ocado Group Plc drop out of Britain’s blue-chip gauge for the first time in six years.】

item.title: 银行因气候风险管理混乱被欧洲央行罚款
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）证实，它正准备对一些贷款机构处以罚款，因为这些机构在应对气候变化给其业务带来的风险方面没有取得足够的进展。【原文：The European Central Bank confirmed that it’s preparing to fine a number of lenders after they failed to make adequate progress in addressing risks posed to their business by climate change.】

item.title: 沙特年度最大上市项目 Fakeeh 在利雅得首次亮相即告崛起
item.description: 沙特医疗保健集团 Soliman Abdel Kader Fakeeh 医生医院公司首次公开募股吸引了 910 亿美元的订单，成为利雅得今年最大的上市企业。【原文：Saudi health-care group Dr. Soliman Abdel Kader Fakeeh Hospital Co. rose in its debut as Riyadh’s biggest listing of the year after the company’s initial public offering attracted $91 billion in orders.】

item.title: 雷-达里奥将美国大选和中国冲突视为全球风险
item.description: 雷-达里奥说，内部冲突将是 "今年的亮点"，尤其是在美国大选结果是否会被双方接受的问题上。【原文：Ray Dalio said internal conflicts will be the “highlight of this year,” particularly on the issue of whether the US election result will be accepted by both sides.】

item.title: 莫迪大选失利对一些全球股票基金来说只是昙花一现
item.description: 对于许多外国投资者来说，印度周二近 4000 亿美元的股市暴跌只是又一个机会，他们可以借此机会买入他们眼中世界上最有前途的经济体之一。【原文：For many foreign investors, India’s near-$400 billion stock-market wipeout on Tuesday is just another opportunity to buy into what they see as one of the world’s most promising economies.】

item.title: 阿波罗的克莱因曼期待更多类似英特尔 110 亿美元协议的交易
item.description: 斯科特-克莱因曼（Scott Kleinman）说，他预计阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.【原文：Scott Kleinman said he expects Apollo Global Management Inc. to participate in more deals similar to the $11 billion joint venture it inked with Intel Corp. this week as companies look for creative ways to meet their growing capital needs.】

item.title: 黑客攻击导致伦敦医院瘫痪，这只是英国遭遇的最新一起黑客攻击事件
item.description: 去年 6 月，一个名为 "黑猫"（BlackCat）的俄罗斯网络犯罪团伙入侵了巴兹健康 NHS 信托基金会（英国国民医疗服务体系的一部分，在伦敦运营多家医院），并在网上公布了部分信息，企图敲诈勒索。【原文：In June of last year, a Russian cybercrime gang called BlackCat hacked the Barts Health NHS Trust, a part of the UK’s National Health Service that operates several hospitals in London, and published some of it online in an extortion attempt.】

item.title: 激进投资者向伦敦企业发出了一个简单的信息：到其他地方上市
item.description: 希望获得更好回报的激进投资者正试图说服伦敦的公司到海外上市。【原文：Activist investors looking for better returns are trying to convince London’s companies to list overseas.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数将结束连续两日下滑
item.description: 伦敦城。摄影师：Mike Kemp/Getty Images【原文：The City of London. Photographer: Mike Kemp/Getty Images】

item.title: 监督机构警告：爱尔兰必须在下一份预算中保持克制
item.description: 爱尔兰财政监督机构警告说，爱尔兰政府在制定下一份预算时必须保持克制，否则将面临经济过热的风险。【原文：The Irish government needs to show restraint when setting its next budget or risk overheating the economy, the state’s fiscal watchdog has warned.】

item.title: 轴心国称莫迪联盟可能会收紧财政政策
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）在其执政的印度人民党（Bharatiya Janata Party）失去议会多数席位后，正在制定联合政府计划。【原文：Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who is putting in plans for a coalition government after his ruling Bharatiya Janata Party lost a majority in parliament, will most likely aim for a lower budget gap, a top economist said.】

item.title: 世界银行称肯尼亚计划回购 10 亿美元欧洲债券
item.description: 世界银行表示，肯尼亚计划今年再次提前回购其欧元债券，作为改善该国债务偿还状况计划的一部分。【原文：Kenya plans another early buyback of its eurobonds this year as part of plans to smooth out the nation’s debt-repayment profile, the World Bank said.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 如果你需要提醒，市场不是选民
item.description:
首先，我们过于依赖民意调查，而且倾向于误判政治家上台后会做什么。【原文：

There’s too much reliance on opinion polls, for a start, and a tendency to misjudge what politicians will do once in office.

】

item.title: 富裕买家回流，香港豪宅销售反弹
item.description: 香港豪宅销售在第一季度出现复苏，原因是房地产限购令的取消吸引了富裕买家的回归。【原文：Hong Kong’s luxury residential sales recovered in the first quarter as the removal of property curbs lured back wealthy buyers.】

item.title: 英国市场无舵漂流
item.description:
历届保守党政府监督了英镑的下跌和英国股票的缩水。【原文：

Successive Tory governments have overseen the decline of the pound and the diminishing of UK equities. 

】

item.title: 欧洲央行历史性降息或将巩固欧洲股市的牛市地位
item.description: 欧洲央行本周召开的历史性会议可能会成为推动地区股市再创新高的催化剂。【原文：A historic European Central Bank meeting this week may be the catalyst that drives regional equities to new peaks.】

item.title: 欧洲央行的通胀挑战看起来越来越像美联储的挑战
item.description: 欧元区通胀率的回升正越来越多地引起人们将其与美国进行比较；这加剧了人们的担忧，即欧洲中央银行在降低利率时可能会面临与美联储类似的障碍。【原文：The uptick in euro-zone inflation is increasingly drawing comparisons to the US — fueling concern that the European Central Bank could face similar impediments to lowering interest rates as the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 瑞士就欧洲最高医疗费用进行投票，辩论内容与美国如出一辙
item.description: 瑞士人正准备投票决定是否限制医疗系统的个人费用，因为该系统向用户收取的费用比欧洲任何其他国家都要高。【原文：The Swiss are getting ready to vote on whether to curb the personal costs of a health system that charges its users more than in any other country in Europe.】

item.title: 降息推动瑞典房价回升
item.description: 随着瑞典央行开始放松紧缩政策，消费者对经济更加乐观，瑞典的房价在五月份有所上涨。【原文：Swedish home prices rose in May as the country’s central bank started unwinding a tightening campaign and consumers became more upbeat about the economy.】

item.title: 波兰因担心工资问题将维持利率稳定
item.description: 对工资上涨的担忧日益加剧，这可能会说服波兰央行连续第八个月甚至更长时间维持利率不变。【原文：Mounting concerns over rising wages will likely convince Poland’s central bank to leave interest rates unchanged for an eighth consecutive month, or even longer.】

item.title: 印度大选结果让紧张的莫迪公牛松了一口气
item.description: 早上好，我是驻孟买的证券记者阿舒托什。由于这两天的密集活动，我们的市场成为全球焦点，而总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）则是这一切的中心。莫迪的政党在大选中表现不佳，导致昨天股市暴跌，但我们可能会迎来一些反弹；很明显，莫迪将在盟友的帮助下继续领导国家。再过几天，情况就会恢复正常。【原文：Good morning, this is Ashutosh, an equities reporter in Mumbai. Our markets are in the global spotlight, thanks to two days of intense activity, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi right at the center of it all. His party’s less-than-stellar election win sent equities plummeting yesterday but we could be in for a bit of rebound — it’s pretty clear that Modi will continue to lead the country, with some help from allies. Things should get back to normal in just a few days.】

item.title: 中国异常庞大的铜库存引发需求担忧
item.description: 中国的铜库存在一年中应该快速减少的时候却在增加，这种反常现象凸显了人们对全球最大市场需求的担忧。【原文：China’s copper inventories are growing at exactly the time of year when they should be shrinking fast — an anomaly that underscores concerns about demand in the world’s biggest market.】

item.title: 路透社称卡塔尔主权基金将收购中国大型共同基金公司 10% 的股份
item.description: 据路透社报道，卡塔尔主权财富基金已同意从私募股权公司 Primavera Capital 收购中国最大的共同基金公司之一--华夏基金管理有限公司 10% 的股份。【原文：Qatar’s sovereign wealth fund has agreed to buy a 10% stake in China Asset Management Co., one of the nation’s largest mutual fund firms, from private equity company Primavera Capital, Reuters reported.】

item.title: 贝莱德、Citadel 支持德州后起之秀挑战纽交所和纳斯达克
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc., Citadel Securities and other investors are backing an upstart Texas stock market to challenge to the New York Stock Exchange and Nasdaq Inc.】
